answers.answer: This is a little hard to read, those  +++++'s weren't needed.You need to go to the doctor. Your symptoms could be diabetes, or many other things.A two liter of what ? Sugar filled soda? What do you eat? How much. Are you overweight?Facial numbness? Not that I know of or have heard from any other diabetics.How old are you?Bottom line is you need to have a complete physical and blood work.Wish I could help more.You can't be diagnosed this way, and many of your symptoms are vague and contradictory.good luck

Hi,from what you're saying I really think you should see a doctor.You are very young to be feeling like this and your symptoms could be diabetes, or it could be something else.You should be drinking plenty of clean water, not alcholol or mountain dew.

Thanks for explaining about your plus signs lol.  I was getting cross eyed.Please go to the doctor . If you don't have the money , borrow it. What Sally said is true.  until your doctor figures out what is going on please stay away from alcohol and soda with sugar in it. Even Mountain Dew with it's large amount of caffeine can cause palpitations.I am very concerned that you said you were a heavy drinker for 2 years before this.  It can destroy your liver and if you are diabetic make you seriously ill. How is your diet? Honesty (:Please don't put off the doctors visit, as someone said "Your way too young"

Hi,you are way too young for this.  I think this is your wakeup call to get your life and health back on track.you can start with small changes.  First cut out all that sugary stuff.Try to eat some fruit and a few cups of veges every day.  Chicken is ok, but it should be roasted or broiled rathe rthan fried or battered.  If you have it fried or battered remove the batter and the skin.Please do get to see a doctor.  I am very concerned at what you are experiencing.Best wishes
